text.div:
RIZIV_INAMI

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://www.hl7belgium.org/fhir/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.be.riziv

RIZIV-INAMI - Patient Summary Record Implementation Guide

name: RIZIV_INAMI
title: RIZIV-INAMI Patient Record
description: RIZIV-INAMI - Patient Summary Record Implementation Guide

grouping.name: Allergy Intolerance
grouping.description: Allergy / Intolerance resources. These artefacts define the constraints and vocabulary necessary to record allergies and intolerances, suspected or confirmed.  A few example resources and scenario demonstrate the use of these resources.

grouping.name: Patient Will
grouping.description: Patient Will profile and vocabulary. The Patient Will captures a patient's expressed preferences related to care provision.   The Logical Data Model defines the functional data needs.   An example demonstrates the use of the profile.

grouping.name: Addiction
grouping.description: The profile for Addiction, intended to capture known or suspected substance or other addictions.    The Logical Data Model defines the functional data needs.   An example demonstrates the use of the profile.

grouping.name: Vaccination
grouping.description: Vaccination related resources.  These artefacts define the constraints and vocabulary necessary to record the administration of vaccine administrations, including the reference to a vaccination schema or protocol, and eventual immediate reactions.  The Logical Data Model defines the functional data needs.   The vocabulary resources help ensure conformity and data consistency.   The profile and extensions define the technical specifications.   A set of examples demonstrates the use of the profile.

grouping.name: Problem
grouping.description: The Problem resources are intended to capture a short description of a patient's clinical condition.   The Logical Data Model defines the functional data needs.   The vocabulary resources help ensure conformity and data consistency.   The profile and extensions define the technical specifications.   A set of examples demonstrates the use of the profile.

grouping.name: Score Results
grouping.description: The Score Results resource captures an overal assessment score about a health indicator associated with a patient.   The vocabulary resources help ensure conformity and data consistency.   The profile defines the technical specifications.   A set of examples demonstrates the use of the profile.

grouping.name: Referral Prescription
grouping.description: The Referral Prescription defines the exchange when ordering services such as nursing care, physiotherapy, or diagnostic procedures such as lab, imaging

resource.name: Addiction BE profile
resource.description: Belgian Profile to capture Addictions (on substances or others)

resource.name: Addiction Quantifier extension
resource.description: Belgian Extension to allow quantification of addictions (on substances or others) - for example 10 packs per week, 1 bottle per day

resource.name: Patient Will core BE profile
resource.description: The Core BE profile for Patient Will

resource.name: Vaccination core BE profile
resource.description: The Core BE profile for Vaccination (event)

resource.name: CodeSystem - Care location
resource.description: The location of the care event

resource.name: CodeSystem - vaccination confirmation status
resource.description: The list of vaccination confirmation status

resource.name: CodeSystem - vaccination status-reason
resource.description: The list of vaccination status reason

resource.name: CodeSystem - Vaccine Administration Route
resource.description: The list of administration routes for vaccines

resource.name: ValueSet - Vaccine Administration Route
resource.description: The list of administration routes for vaccines

resource.name: ValueSet - vaccination confirmation status
resource.description: The list of vaccination confirmation status

resource.name: ValueSet - vaccination status reason
resource.description: The list of vaccination status reason

resource.name: Toto finding - fever
resource.description: Toto - example of finding that prevents vaccination (fever)

resource.name: Problem core BE profile
resource.description: The Core BE profile for Problem

resource.name: ValueSet - Problem origin type
resource.description: Set of values for problem origin type

resource.name: Example - Refuted Allergy
resource.description: Allergy has been refuted - confirmed as non-existent

resource.name: ExampleScenario - Laboratory Ordering Workflow
resource.description: Lab Order Placed and Results Submitted

resource.name: Example - FINDRISC score result
resource.description: FIDNRISC score result example, obtained from a QuestionnaireResponse

Belgian federal profile for a patient. Initially based on the functional description of the NIHDI. Special remarks for KMEHR users: following elements in KMEHR are not available in this FHIR resource. If needed, an extension can be defined in a future iteration of these specifications: the 'deathlocation' (location is not available but the death of the patient is expressed by either date or Boolean cfr. infra.), the 'insurancystatus' (covered in a seperate FHIR resource: Coverage), 'insurancymembership' (covered in a seperate FHIR resource: Coverage) and 'profession' (covered in a possible future FHIR resource: OccupationalData.)
Belgian federal profile for an organization. Initially based on the functional description of the NIHDI.

Belgain federal profile on address, to provide the possibility in the 'line' element to provide a seperate streetname, housenumber and postal box. It is always RECOMMENDED to give these elements seperately.

resource.name: BeInformParty
resource.description: Extra parties that need to be informed of the outcome, besides the prescriber.

resource.name: CodeSystem Modified Katz assessment scale
resource.description: CodeSystem Modified Katz assessment scale for independent living.
Codes to define the high level category for a referral prescription. SNOMED-CT codes in this valueset are just a draft proposal to give a general idea - pending an official valueset.
Codes to explain the current status of a referral prescription.
The common structure for referral prescription.

resource.name: BeMEasure
resource.description:
A record of an observation made by the patient or a professional, with or without a measurement device. This is the preferred profile to be used in specified cases like glucose monitoring, BMI, etc.
The list of cases that are supported by this profile (and for which this profile is preferred) is evolving, but for those cases that are included, this profile should be used, instead of a generic Observation.

resource.name: BeStatusReason
resource.description: Status reason in Belgium. Initially defined as supporting CodeSystem for the referral prescription.
